title.en: Genealogical Tables of the Three Dynasties

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：五帝、三代之記，尚矣。

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: Five Emperors, Three Dynasties records, far ancient.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian said: The records of the Five Emperors and Three Dynasties go far back in time.

sentences.zh: 自殷以前諸侯不可得而譜，周以來乃頗可著。

translations.literal: From Yin before feudal lords cannot obtained and genealogized, Zhou since then considerably can recorded.
translations.idiomatic: Before the Yin dynasty, the feudal lords cannot be genealogically charted. Since the Zhou, they can be considerably recorded.

sentences.zh: 孔子因史文次春秋，紀元年，正時日月，蓋其詳哉。

translations.literal: Confucius followed historical texts arranged Spring Autumn, recorded first year, corrected seasons days months, indeed its detailed.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius followed the historical texts and arranged the Spring and Autumn Annals, recording the first year, correcting the seasons, days, and months - indeed how detailed!

sentences.zh: 至於序尚書則略，無年月；

translations.literal: As for arranging the Documents of Antiquity then brief, no years months;
translations.idiomatic: As for arranging the Documents of Antiquity, it was brief, with no years or months;

sentences.zh: 或頗有，然多闕，不可錄。

translations.literal: Some considerably had, yet many missing, cannot recorded.
translations.idiomatic: Some considerably had them, yet many were missing and could not be recorded.

sentences.zh: 故疑則傳疑，蓋其慎也。

translations.literal: Therefore doubt then transmit doubt, indeed its cautious.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore when in doubt, transmit doubt - indeed how cautious!

translations.literal: The Grand Historian said: The records of the Five Emperors and Three Dynasties go far back in time. Before the Yin dynasty, the feudal lords cannot be genealogically charted. Since the Zhou, they can be considerably recorded. Confucius followed the historical texts and arranged the Spring and Autumn Annals, recording the first year, correcting the seasons, days, and months - indeed how detailed! As for arranging the Documents of Antiquity, it was brief, with no years or months; Some considerably had them, yet many were missing and could not be recorded. Therefore when in doubt, transmit doubt - indeed how cautious!

sentences.zh: 余讀諜記，黃帝以來皆有年數。

translations.literal: I read secret records, Yellow Emperor since all have year numbers.
translations.idiomatic: I read secret records - since the Yellow Emperor, all have year counts.

sentences.zh: 稽其歷譜諜終始五德之傳，古文咸不同，乖異。

translations.literal: Check their calendar genealogies secret records beginning end five virtues transmission, ancient texts all different, divergent.
translations.idiomatic: Checking their calendar genealogies and secret records of the beginning and end of the five virtues transmission, the ancient texts are all different and divergent.

sentences.zh: 夫子之弗論次其年月，豈虛哉！

translations.literal: Master not discussed arranged their years months, how vain!
translations.idiomatic: The Master did not discuss and arrange their years and months - how could it be in vain!

sentences.zh: 於是以五帝系諜、尚書集世紀黃帝以連山訖共和為世表。

translations.literal: Thereupon with Five Emperors genealogical records, Documents of Antiquity collected century Yellow Emperor with Lianshan until Gonghe as generation table.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon, using the Five Emperors genealogical records and the Documents of Antiquity collected century, from the Yellow Emperor through Lianshan until Gonghe as the generation table.

translations.literal: I read secret records - since the Yellow Emperor, all have year counts. Checking their calendar genealogies and secret records of the beginning and end of the five virtues transmission, the ancient texts are all different and divergent. The Master did not discuss and arrange their years and months - how could it be in vain! Thereupon, using the Five Emperors genealogical records and the Documents of Antiquity collected century, from the Yellow Emperor through Lianshan until Gonghe as the generation table.

cells.literal: Lu Zhou duke Dan, Martial King younger brother. First enfeoffed.
cells.idiomatic: Duke Zhou of Lu Dan, younger brother of King Wu. First enfeoffment.

cells.content: 齊太公尚，文王、武王師。初封。
cells.literal: Qi Grand Duke Shang, Wen Wang, Martial King teacher. First enfeoffed.
cells.idiomatic: Grand Duke of Qi Shang, teacher of Wen Wang and Martial King. First enfeoffment.

cells.literal: Jin Tang Uncle Yu, Martial King son. First enfeoffed.
cells.idiomatic: Uncle Tang of Jin Yu, son of King Wu. First enfeoffment.

cells.content: 秦惡來，助紂。父飛廉，有力。
cells.literal: Qin E Lai, assisted Zhou. Father Fei Lian, had strength.
cells.idiomatic: Qin E Lai, assisted Zhou. Father Fei Lian, had strength.

cells.content: 楚熊繹。繹父鬻熊，事文王。初封。
cells.literal: Chu Xiong Yi. Yi father Yu Xiong, served Wen Wang. First enfeoffed.
cells.idiomatic: Chu Xiong Yi. Yi's father Yu Xiong, served Wen Wang. First enfeoffment.

cells.literal: Song Wei Zi Qi, Zhou concubine brother. First enfeoffed.
cells.idiomatic: Wei Zi of Song Qi, concubine brother of Zhou. First enfeoffment.

cells.literal: Wei Kang uncle, Martial King younger brother. First enfeoffed.
cells.idiomatic: Uncle Kang of Wei, younger brother of King Wu. First enfeoffment.

cells.literal: Chen Hu duke Man, Shun after. First enfeoffed.
cells.idiomatic: Duke Hu of Chen Man, descendant of Shun. First enfeoffment.

cells.literal: Cai Uncle Du, Martial King younger brother. First enfeoffed.
cells.idiomatic: Uncle Cai Du, younger brother of King Wu. First enfeoffment.

cells.literal: Cao Uncle Zhen Duo, Martial King younger brother. First enfeoffed.
cells.idiomatic: Uncle Cao Zhen Duo, younger brother of King Wu. First enfeoffment.

cells.literal: Yan Duke of Shao Shi, Zhou same surname. First enfeoffed.
cells.idiomatic: Duke of Shao of Yan, same surname as Zhou. First enfeoffment.

cells.literal: Kang King Zhao punishments weapons forty more years.
cells.idiomatic: King Kang Zhao - punishments and weapons unused for forty-plus years.
Wei Zhong, younger brother of Qi.

cells.content: 昭王瑕南巡不返。不赴，諱之。
cells.literal: Zhao King Xia south toured not return. Not attended, tabooed it.
cells.idiomatic: King Zhao Xia toured south and did not return. Did not attend, tabooed it.

cells.content: 穆王滿。作甫刑。荒服不至。
cells.literal: Mu King Man. Made Fu punishments. Remote service not arrived.
cells.idiomatic: King Mu Man. Made the Fu punishments. Remote service did not arrive.

cells.literal: Yang duke, Kao duke younger brother.
cells.idiomatic: Duke Yang, younger brother of Duke Kao.

cells.literal: Min duke, Ding duke younger brother.
cells.idiomatic: Duke Min, younger brother of Duke Ding.

cells.content: 懿王堅。周道衰，詩人作刺。
cells.literal: Yi King Jian. Zhou way declined, poets made satire.
cells.idiomatic: King Yi Jian. Zhou way declined, poets made satire.

cells.literal: Yang duke, Min duke younger brother.
cells.idiomatic: Duke Yang, younger brother of Duke Min.

cells.literal: Xiao King Fang, Yi king younger brother.
cells.idiomatic: King Xiao Fang, younger brother of King Yi.

cells.literal: Yi King Xie, Yi king son.
cells.idiomatic: King Yi Xie, son of King Yi.

cells.literal: Xian duke, Li duke younger brother.
cells.idiomatic: Duke Xian, younger brother of Duke Li.

cells.content: 厲王胡。以惡聞過亂，出奔，遂死於彘。
cells.literal: Li King Hu. Because hated hearing faults chaos, fled, then died at Zhi.
cells.idiomatic: King Li Hu. Because hated hearing faults and caused chaos, fled, then died at Zhi.
Xiong Yan, younger brother of Hong.
Gonghe, the two Bo administered the government.

cells.literal: Wu duke, Zhen duke younger brother.
cells.idiomatic: Duke Wu, younger brother of Duke Zhen.

sentences.zh: 張夫子問褚先生曰：「詩言契、后稷皆無父而生。

translations.literal: Zhang Fuzi asked Chu Mr said: 'Poetry speaks Jie, Hou Ji all no father born.
translations.idiomatic: Master Zhang asked Master Chu said: 'The Poetry says Jie and Hou Ji were both born without fathers.

sentences.zh: 今案諸傳記咸言有父，父皆黃帝子也，得無與詩謬秋？」

translations.literal: Now examine various biographies all say have father, fathers all Yellow Emperor sons also, can it be with poetry contradictory?'
translations.idiomatic: Now examining the various biographies, they all say they had fathers, and the fathers were all sons of the Yellow Emperor. Could it be contradictory to the Poetry?'

translations.literal: Master Zhang asked Master Chu said: 'The Poetry says Jie and Hou Ji were both born without fathers. Now examining the various biographies, they all say they had fathers, and the fathers were all sons of the Yellow Emperor. Could it be contradictory to the Poetry?'

sentences.zh: 褚先生曰：「不然。

translations.literal: Chu Mr said: 'Not so.
translations.idiomatic: Master Chu said: 'Not so.

sentences.zh: 詩言契生於卵，后稷人跡者，欲見其有天命精誠之意耳。

translations.literal: Poetry speaks Jie born from egg, Hou Ji human footprints, wished to show they had heaven mandate sincere intentions only.
translations.idiomatic: The Poetry speaks of Jie being born from an egg and Hou Ji from human footprints, only wishing to show they had heaven's mandate and sincere intentions.

sentences.zh: 鬼神不能自成，須人而生，柰何無父而生乎！

translations.literal: Ghosts spirits cannot self-complete, must rely on people born, how can no father born!
translations.idiomatic: Ghosts and spirits cannot complete themselves, they must be born through people. How could they be born without fathers!

sentences.zh: 一言有父，一言無父，信以傳信，疑以傳疑，故兩言之。

translations.literal: One says has father, one says no father, believe to transmit believe, doubt to transmit doubt, therefore both speak.
translations.idiomatic: One says they had fathers, one says they had no fathers. Transmit what is believable as believable, transmit doubts as doubts, therefore both are spoken.

sentences.zh: 堯知契、稷皆賢人，天之所生，故封之契七十里，後十餘世至湯，王天下。

translations.literal: Yao knew Jie, Ji all worthy people, heaven what born, therefore enfeoffed Jie seventy li, after ten more generations to Tang, king tianxia.
translations.idiomatic: Yao knew Jie and Ji were both worthy people, born by heaven, therefore enfeoffed Jie with seventy li, and after ten-plus generations came to Tang who became king of tianxia.

sentences.zh: 堯知后稷子孫之後王也，故益封之百里，其後世且千歲，至文王而有天下。

translations.literal: Yao knew Hou Ji descendants later kings also, therefore additionally enfeoffed him hundred li, his later generations nearly thousand years, to Wen Wang then had tianxia.
translations.idiomatic: Yao knew Hou Ji's descendants would later be kings, therefore additionally enfeoffed him with a hundred li. His later generations lasted nearly a thousand years, until Wen Wang then had tianxia.

sentences.zh: 詩傳曰：『湯之先為契，無父而生。

translations.literal: Poetry transmission said: 'Tang what ancestor Jie, no father born.
translations.idiomatic: The Poetry transmission said: 'Tang's ancestor was Jie, born without a father.

sentences.zh: 契母與姊妹浴於玄丘水，有燕銜卵墮之，契母得，故含之，誤吞之，即生契。

translations.literal: Jie mother with elder sisters bathed at Xuanqiu water, had swallow held egg fell it, Jie mother got, therefore held it, mistakenly swallowed it, immediately gave birth Jie.
translations.idiomatic: Jie's mother was bathing with her sisters at Xuanqiu water when a swallow holding an egg dropped it. Jie's mother got it, therefore held it, mistakenly swallowed it, and immediately gave birth to Jie.

sentences.zh: 契生而賢，堯立為司徒，姓之曰子氏。

translations.literal: Jie born and worthy, Yao established as Situ, surnamed him Zi clan.
translations.idiomatic: Jie was born worthy. Yao established him as Situ and surnamed him the Zi clan.

sentences.zh: 子者茲；

translations.literal: Zi what Ci;
translations.idiomatic: Zi means Ci;

sentences.zh: 茲，益大也。

translations.literal: Ci, increasingly great also.
translations.idiomatic: Ci means increasingly great.

sentences.zh: 詩人美而頌之曰「殷社芒芒，天命玄鳥，降而生商」。

translations.literal: Poets praised and praised him said 'Yin altar vast vast, heaven mandate dark bird, descended gave birth Shang'.
translations.idiomatic: The poets praised and sang of him saying 'The Yin altar is vast and vast, heaven's mandate dark bird descended and gave birth to Shang'.

sentences.zh: 商者質，殷號也。

translations.literal: Shang what solid, Yin designation also.
translations.idiomatic: Shang is solid, Yin's designation.

sentences.zh: 文王之先為后稷，后稷亦無父而生。

translations.literal: Wen Wang what ancestor Hou Ji, Hou Ji also no father born.
translations.idiomatic: Wen Wang's ancestor was Hou Ji, Hou Ji also born without a father.

sentences.zh: 后稷母為姜嫄，出見大人蹟而履踐之，知於身，則生后稷。

translations.literal: Hou Ji mother was Jiang Yuan, went out saw great person footprints stepped on them, knew in body, then gave birth Hou Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Hou Ji's mother was Jiang Yuan. She went out and saw great person footprints, stepped on them, knew it in her body, then gave birth to Hou Ji.

sentences.zh: 姜嫄以為無父，賤而棄之道中，牛羊避不踐也。

translations.literal: Jiang Yuan took as no father, lowly abandoned on road middle, cattle sheep avoided not trampled also.
translations.idiomatic: Jiang Yuan took it as having no father, lowly abandoned it in the middle of the road, but cattle and sheep avoided and did not trample it.

sentences.zh: 抱之山中，山者養之。

translations.literal: Embraced it mountain middle, mountain people nurtured it.
translations.idiomatic: She embraced it in the mountains, and mountain people nurtured it.

sentences.zh: 又捐之大澤，鳥覆席食之。

translations.literal: Again abandoned it great marsh, birds covered warmed fed it.
translations.idiomatic: Again she abandoned it in the great marsh, but birds covered and warmed and fed it.

sentences.zh: 姜嫄怪之，於是知其天子，乃取長之。

translations.literal: Jiang Yuan wondered at it, thereupon knew its Son of Heaven, then took raised it.
translations.idiomatic: Jiang Yuan wondered at it. Thereupon she knew it was a Son of Heaven, then took and raised it.

sentences.zh: 堯知其賢才，立以為大農，姓之曰姬氏。

translations.literal: Yao knew his worthy talent, established as great farmer, surnamed him Ji clan.
translations.idiomatic: Yao knew his worthy talent, established him as great farmer, surnamed him the Ji clan.

sentences.zh: 姬者，本也。

translations.literal: Ji what root also.
translations.idiomatic: Ji means root.

sentences.zh: 詩人美而頌之曰「厥初生民」，深修益成，而道后稷之始也。』

translations.literal: Poets praised praised him said 'its beginning gave birth people', deep cultivated increasingly accomplished, spoke Hou Ji beginning also.'
translations.idiomatic: The poets praised and sang of him saying 'its beginning gave birth to the people', deeply cultivated and increasingly accomplished, speaking of Hou Ji's beginning.'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：『昔者堯命契為子氏，為有湯也。

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Former ones Yao commanded Jie as Zi clan, for had Tang also.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'Former ones Yao commanded Jie as the Zi clan, because he would have Tang.

sentences.zh: 命后稷為姬氏，為有文王也。

translations.literal: Commanded Hou Ji as Ji clan, for had Wen Wang also.
translations.idiomatic: Commanded Hou Ji as the Ji clan, because he would have Wen Wang.

sentences.zh: 大王命季歷，明天瑞也。

translations.literal: Great King commanded Ji Li, made clear heaven auspicious also.
translations.idiomatic: The Great King commanded Ji Li, made clear heaven's auspicious signs.

sentences.zh: 太伯之吳，遂生源也。』

translations.literal: Tai Bo to Wu, then gave birth source also.'
translations.idiomatic: Tai Bo went to Wu, then gave birth to the source.'

sentences.zh: 天命難言，非聖人莫能見。

translations.literal: Heaven mandate difficult speak, not sage none can see.
translations.idiomatic: Heaven's mandate is difficult to speak of, only sages can see it.

sentences.zh: 舜、禹、契、后稷皆黃帝子孫也。

translations.literal: Shun, Yu, Jie, Hou Ji all Yellow Emperor descendants also.
translations.idiomatic: Shun, Yu, Jie, and Hou Ji are all Yellow Emperor descendants.

sentences.zh: 黃帝策天命而治天下，德澤深後世，故其子孫皆復立為天子，是天之報有德也。

translations.literal: Yellow Emperor tallied heaven mandate governed tianxia, virtue favor deep later generations, therefore his descendants all again established as Sons of Heaven, this heaven what repays virtuous also.
translations.idiomatic: The Yellow Emperor tallied heaven's mandate and governed tianxia. His virtue and favor were deep for later generations, therefore his descendants were all again established as Sons of Heaven. This is heaven repaying the virtuous.

sentences.zh: 人不知，以為閒從布衣匹夫起耳。

translations.literal: People not know, took as idly following plain clothed commoner arose only.
translations.idiomatic: People did not know, thinking he idly followed and arose from a plain-clothed commoner only.

sentences.zh: 夫布衣匹夫安能無故而起王天下乎？

translations.literal: Indeed plain clothed commoner how can without reason arise king tianxia?
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, how could a plain-clothed commoner arise and become king of tianxia without reason?

sentences.zh: 其有天命然。」

translations.literal: Its have heaven mandate thus.'
translations.idiomatic: It is because he had heaven's mandate.'

translations.literal: Master Chu said: 'Not so. The Poetry speaks of Jie being born from an egg and Hou Ji from human footprints, only wishing to show they had heaven's mandate and sincere intentions. Ghosts and spirits cannot complete themselves, they must be born through people. How could they be born without fathers! One says they had fathers, one says they had no fathers. Transmit what is believable as believable, transmit doubts as doubts, therefore both are spoken. Yao knew Jie and Ji were both worthy people, born by heaven, therefore enfeoffed Jie with seventy li, and after ten-plus generations came to Tang who became king of tianxia. Yao knew Hou Ji's descendants would later be kings, therefore additionally enfeoffed him with a hundred li. His later generations lasted nearly a thousand years, until Wen Wang then had tianxia. The Poetry transmission said: 'Tang's ancestor was Jie, born without a father. Jie's mother was bathing with her sisters at Xuanqiu water when a swallow holding an egg dropped it. Jie's mother got it, therefore held it, mistakenly swallowed it, and immediately gave birth to Jie. Jie was born worthy. Yao established him as Situ and surnamed him the Zi clan. Zi means Ci; Ci means increasingly great. The poets praised and sang of him saying 'The Yin altar is vast and vast, heaven's mandate dark bird descended and gave birth to Shang'. Shang is solid, Yin's designation. Wen Wang's ancestor was Hou Ji, Hou Ji also born without a father. Hou Ji's mother was Jiang Yuan. She went out and saw great person footprints, stepped on them, knew it in her body, then gave birth to Hou Ji. Jiang Yuan took it as having no father, lowly abandoned it in the middle of the road, but cattle and sheep avoided and did not trample it. She embraced it in the mountains, and mountain people nurtured it. Again she abandoned it in the great marsh, but birds covered and warmed and fed it. Jiang Yuan wondered at it. Thereupon she knew it was a Son of Heaven, then took and raised it. Yao knew his worthy talent, established him as great farmer, surnamed him the Ji clan. Ji means root. The poets praised and sang of him saying 'its beginning gave birth to the people', deeply cultivated and increasingly accomplished, speaking of Hou Ji's beginning.' Confucius said: 'Former ones Yao commanded Jie as the Zi clan, because he would have Tang. Commanded Hou Ji as the Ji clan, because he would have Wen Wang. The Great King commanded Ji Li, made clear heaven's auspicious signs. Tai Bo went to Wu, then gave birth to the source.' Heaven's mandate is difficult to speak of, only sages can see it. Shun, Yu, Jie, and Hou Ji are all Yellow Emperor descendants. The Yellow Emperor tallied heaven's mandate and governed tianxia. His virtue and favor were deep for later generations, therefore his descendants were all again established as Sons of Heaven. This is heaven repaying the virtuous. People did not know, thinking he idly followed and arose from a plain-clothed commoner only. Indeed, how could a plain-clothed commoner arise and become king of tianxia without reason? It is because he had heaven's mandate.'

sentences.zh: 「黃帝後世何王天下之久遠邪？」

translations.literal: 'Yellow Emperor later generations what king tianxia so long distant?'
translations.idiomatic: 'Why did the Yellow Emperor's later generations rule tianxia for so long?'

translations.literal: 'Why did the Yellow Emperor's later generations rule tianxia for so long?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「傳云天下之君王為萬夫之黔首請贖民之命者帝，有福萬世。

translations.literal: Said: 'Transmission says tianxia what rulers for ten thousand men common people request redeem people lives ones emperor, have fortune ten thousand generations.
translations.idiomatic: Said: 'The transmission says that rulers of tianxia who request to redeem the lives of the common people for ten thousand men are emperors, and have fortune for ten thousand generations.

sentences.zh: 黃帝是也。

translations.literal: Yellow Emperor is this.
translations.idiomatic: The Yellow Emperor is such a one.

sentences.zh: 五政明則修禮義，因天時舉兵征伐而利者王，有福千世。

translations.literal: Five governments clear then repair ritual righteousness, follow heaven timing raise troops attack punish beneficial ones king, have fortune thousand generations.
translations.idiomatic: When the five governments are clear then repair ritual and righteousness, follow heaven's timing to raise troops and attack those who are beneficial - such ones become kings, and have fortune for a thousand generations.

sentences.zh: 蜀王，黃帝後世也，至今在漢西南五千里，常來朝降，輸獻於漢，非以其先之有德，澤流後世邪？

translations.literal: Shu king, Yellow Emperor later generations also, until now at Han southwest five thousand li, often come court submit, transport tribute to Han, not because their ancestors had virtue, favor flowed later generations?
translations.idiomatic: The Shu king is also of the Yellow Emperor's later generations. Until now he is five thousand li southwest of Han, often comes to court and submit, transports tribute to Han. Is it not because their ancestors had virtue, with favor flowing to later generations?

sentences.zh: 行道德豈可以忽秋哉！

translations.literal: Practice morality how can be neglected!
translations.idiomatic: Practicing morality, how can it be neglected!

sentences.zh: 人君王者舉而觀之。

translations.literal: Person ruler kings raise observe it.
translations.idiomatic: Ruler-kings should raise and observe this.

sentences.zh: 漢大將軍霍子孟名光者，亦黃帝後世也。

translations.literal: Han great general Huo Zi Meng named Guang, also Yellow Emperor later generations also.
translations.idiomatic: The Han great general Huo Zi Meng named Guang is also of the Yellow Emperor's later generations.

sentences.zh: 此可為博聞遠見者言，固難為淺聞者說也。

translations.literal: This can for broad knowledge far vision ones speak, indeed difficult for shallow knowledge ones explain also.
translations.idiomatic: This can be spoken of to those with broad knowledge and far vision, but is indeed difficult to explain to those with shallow knowledge.

sentences.zh: 何以言之？

translations.literal: What with speak it?
translations.idiomatic: Why speak of it?

sentences.zh: 古諸侯以國為姓。

translations.literal: Ancient feudal lords with state as surname.
translations.idiomatic: Ancient feudal lords took their state as surname.

sentences.zh: 霍者，國名也。

translations.literal: Huo what state name also.
translations.idiomatic: Huo is a state name.

sentences.zh: 武王封弟叔處於霍，後世晉獻公滅霍公，後世為庶民，往來居平陽。

translations.literal: Martial King enfeoffed younger brother Shu Chu at Huo, later generations Jin Xian duke extinguished Huo duke, later generations became common people, came went resided Pingyang.
translations.idiomatic: King Wu enfeoffed his younger brother Shu Chu at Huo. Later generations had Jin Xian duke extinguish the Huo duke. Later generations became common people, coming and going to reside at Pingyang.

sentences.zh: 平陽在河東，河東晉地，分為衛國。

translations.literal: Pingyang at Hedong, Hedong Jin territory, divided into Wei state.
translations.idiomatic: Pingyang is at Hedong, Hedong is Jin territory, divided into the Wei state.

sentences.zh: 以詩言之，亦可為周世。

translations.literal: With Poetry speak it, also can for Zhou generations.
translations.idiomatic: Speaking of it with the Poetry, it can also be for the Zhou generations.

sentences.zh: 周起后稷，后稷無父而生。

translations.literal: Zhou arose Hou Ji, Hou Ji no father born.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou arose from Hou Ji, Hou Ji born without a father.

sentences.zh: 以三代世傳言之，后稷有父名高辛；

translations.literal: With Three Dynasties generations transmission speak it, Hou Ji had father named Gao Xin;
translations.idiomatic: Speaking of it with the Three Dynasties generations transmission, Hou Ji had a father named Gao Xin;

sentences.zh: 高辛，黃帝曾孫。

translations.literal: Gao Xin, Yellow Emperor great grandson.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Xin was the Yellow Emperor's great grandson.

sentences.zh: 黃帝終始傳曰：『漢興百有餘年，有人不短不長，出（自）［白］燕之鄉，持天下之政，時有嬰兒主，欲行車。』

translations.literal: Yellow Emperor beginning end transmission said: 'Han arose hundred more years, had person not short not long, came from Bai Yan district, held tianxia government, time had infant ruler, wished run carriage.'
translations.idiomatic: The Yellow Emperor beginning and end transmission said: 'Han arose over a hundred years, there was a person neither short nor long, came from the Bai Yan district, held tianxia's government. At the time there was an infant ruler, wishing to run the carriage.'

sentences.zh: 霍將軍者，本居平陽（自）［白］燕。

translations.literal: Huo general, originally resided Pingyang Bai Yan.
translations.idiomatic: The Huo general originally resided at Pingyang Bai Yan.

sentences.zh: 臣為郎時，與方士考功會旗亭下，為臣言。

translations.literal: Minister as lang time, with fangshi Kao Gong met at flag pavilion below, for minister spoke.
translations.idiomatic: When minister was a lang, met with fangshi Kao Gong below the flag pavilion, spoke to minister.

sentences.zh: 豈不偉哉！」

translations.literal: How not magnificent!
translations.idiomatic: How magnificent!

translations.literal: Said: 'The transmission says that rulers of tianxia who request to redeem the lives of the common people for ten thousand men are emperors, and have fortune for ten thousand generations. The Yellow Emperor is such a one. When the five governments are clear then repair ritual and righteousness, follow heaven's timing to raise troops and attack those who are beneficial - such ones become kings, and have fortune for a thousand generations. The Shu king is also of the Yellow Emperor's later generations. Until now he is five thousand li southwest of Han, often comes to court and submit, transports tribute to Han. Is it not because their ancestors had virtue, with favor flowing to later generations? Practicing morality, how can it be neglected! Ruler-kings should raise and observe this. The Han great general Huo Zi Meng named Guang is also of the Yellow Emperor's later generations. This can be spoken of to those with broad knowledge and far vision, but is indeed difficult to explain to those with shallow knowledge. Why speak of it? Ancient feudal lords took their state as surname. Huo is a state name. King Wu enfeoffed his younger brother Shu Chu at Huo. Later generations had Jin Xian duke extinguish the Huo duke. Later generations became common people, coming and going to reside at Pingyang. Pingyang is at Hedong, Hedong is Jin territory, divided into the Wei state. Speaking of it with the Poetry, it can also be for the Zhou generations. Zhou arose from Hou Ji, Hou Ji born without a father. Speaking of it with the Three Dynasties generations transmission, Hou Ji had a father named Gao Xin; Gao Xin was the Yellow Emperor's great grandson. The Yellow Emperor beginning and end transmission said: 'Han arose over a hundred years, there was a person neither short nor long, came from the Bai Yan district, held tianxia's government. At the time there was an infant ruler, wishing to run the carriage.' The Huo general originally resided at Pingyang Bai Yan. When minister was a lang, met with fangshi Kao Gong below the flag pavilion, spoke to minister. How magnificent!
